background: Rotary screw traps are a fundamental means of collecting outmigrating juvenile anadromous species in the Pacific Northwest and elsewhere. The screw trap on Lookingglass Creek provides abundance and life history information for a wild population of native summer steelhead andnaturally spawnedChinook salmonin this sub-watershed of the Grande Ronde Subbasin.
title: Monitoring Lookingglass Creek juvenile salmonid outmigrants with a rotary screw trap
assumptions: Outmigrant abundance estimates made using fish sampled from the screw trap are accurate and unbiased. Fish sampled from the screw trap are representative of the outmigrating population..
objectives: Monitor wild juvenile summer steelhead and natural origin juvenile Chinook salmon population status and trends.
